model

Class Admin

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Admin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Admin
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This data structure holds the list of Users in the system It is also used to populate the listview of users on the admin system
    Author:
    Jake
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • storeFile

        public static final java.lang.String storeFile
        The file we are serializing to
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Admin

        public Admin()
        Creates a new Admin instance. Creates a new instance of the observable list and adds the admin to it. Admin should only be created the first time the application boots up since Admin will be retrieved from serialized data if it exists

    • Method Detail

      • populateUserList

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<User> populateUserList()
        Returns the list of users when the controller asks for it
        Returns:
        ObservableList of Users for the controller

      • user_exists

        public boolean user_exists(java.lang.String n)
        Function to see if the username for the intended new user is already taken
        Parameters:
        n - String of the name of the user we're trying to add
        Returns:
        true if the username is already in the list (case insensitive), false if not

      • add_user

        public void add_user(java.lang.String n)
        Adds a user to the list
        Parameters:
        n - String of the name of the user

      • remove_user

        public void remove_user(java.lang.String n)
        removes a user from the list
        Parameters:
        n - String of the name of the user to remove

      • getUser

        public User getUser(int index)
        Gets the user at the given index
        Parameters:
        index - int value of the index of the user
        Returns:
        User at the index

      • getUserByName

        public User getUserByName(java.lang.String n)
        Searches the observable list of users and returns the one with the name given, if they exist
        Parameters:
        n - The name of the user to find
        Returns:
        User instance associated with the given name

      • get_saved_list

        public java.util.ArrayList<User> get_saved_list()
        Retrives the list only used when serializing since the observable list usually used isn't serializable
        Returns:
        ArrayList of users stored during serialization

      • retrieve_serialized_data

        public static Admin retrieve_serialized_data()
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Reads the serialized data back into the program. Places the user list back from the ArrayList used to store it to the observable list normally used
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something is wrong with the file we are trying to access
        ClassNotFoundExceptin - if something is wrong with a model we are trying to read
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • serialize

        public void serialize()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Serialize the data stored in admin Moves the data in the observable array list to the array list and tells User objects to do the same thing
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong with serializing
